"EXCHANGE OF CERTAIN MINERAL INTERESTS IN BILLINGS COUNTY, NORTH DAKOTA." The purpose of this section is to consolidate mineral interests in the Little Missouri National Grasslands in Billings County, North Dakota through the exchange of Federal and private mineral interests to enhance land management capability and environmental protection. Burlington Resources Oil & Gas Company is required to convey title acceptable to the Secretary of Agriculture within 45 days for the exchange to take place. The Secretary will convey Federal rights to Burlington through a quitclaim deed, subject to valid existing rights. If Burlington conveys the remaining non-oil gas mineral interests to the Secretary within 180 days, the Secretary will exchange Federal rights in National Forest System lands and National Grasslands in North Dakota to the owners. The Secretary will convey Federal rights to Burlington through a quitclaim deed, subject to valid existing rights. Burlington must release all leasehold and contractual interests in oil and gas interests to be conveyed to the United States. The values of exchanged interests must be approximately equal. Burlington will have access to Federally-owned surface lands for exploration and development. Burlington will have rights to surface occupancy and use on federally owned surface estate overlying oil and gas rights conveyed to them under the Act. All activities on environmentally sensitive National Forest System lands must adhere to the terms of a Memorandum of Understanding between Burlington and the Forest Service. The Act requires a map to be provided to specific committees, kept on file, and made available for public inspection. The exchange under the Act is deemed to meet all federal laws, including environmental and cultural laws. The Act ensures the continuation of multiple use. The Act ensures the continuation of multiple use in the Little Missouri National Grasslands, including outdoor recreation, range, timber, watershed, and fish and wildlife purposes. Federal grazing permits in designated areas will not be affected by the authorized exchange.
